entry.tran: 足智多谋的;机智的;办法多的
entry.def: Someone who is resourceful is good at finding ways of dealing with problems.

example.ex: He was amazingly inventive and resourceful, and played a major role in my career...
example.tran: 他极具创造力，而且足智多谋，在我的职业生涯中起到了重要的作用。

example.ex: Her mother was a resourceful and energetic woman.
example.tran: 她母亲是一个足智多谋、精力充沛的女人。

means.word_mean: 1. having inner resources; adroit or imaginative;

sentences.sentence: "someone who is resourceful is capable of dealing with difficult situations"

auth_sentence.content: Of course, being resourceful, he used other things.
auth_sentence.res_content: Of course, being resourceful, he used other things.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Of course, being resourceful, he used other things.

auth_sentence.content: "I'm a very resourceful woman," she says.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "I'm a very resourceful woman," she says.

auth_sentence.content: This soundtrack is resourceful, driven and enjoyable to listen to.
auth_sentence.res_content: This soundtrack is resourceful, driven and enjoyable to listen to.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This soundtrack is resourceful, driven and enjoyable to listen to.

Sentence.sentence: Almost every child, on the first day he sets foot in a school building, is smarter, more curious, less afraid of what he doesn't know, better at finding and figuring things out, more confident, resourceful (机敏的), persistent and independent than he will ever be again in his schooling – or, unless he is very unusual and very lucky, for the rest of his life.

means.word_mean: 资源丰富的;富于机智的;有策略的

sentences.en: He is very clever and endlessly resourceful.
What is immediately striking is how resourceful the children are.
sentences.cn: 最令人注目的是孩子们的机智聪明。
